metadata.notes: Claims collected from public fact-checking sources. Each claim includes fact-checker verdict, reasoning, and evidence links.

claims.text: The United States has the highest per capita healthcare spending in the world
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: OECD health data confirms the US spends significantly more per person on healthcare than any other developed nation, approximately $11,000 per capita annually.

claims.text: The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of the world's oxygen
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: While the Amazon is important, it produces approximately 6-9% of global oxygen. Much oxygen production comes from ocean phytoplankton. The myth conflates oxygen production with carbon storage.

claims.text: Fluoride in drinking water prevents tooth decay
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Extensive research by CDC, WHO, and dental organizations confirms water fluoridation reduces tooth decay by approximately 25% in children and 15% in adults.

claims.text: Mobile phones cause brain cancer
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Multiple large-scale studies including the INTERPHONE study found no conclusive evidence that mobile phone use causes brain cancer. WHO classifies RF as 'possibly carcinogenic' but evidence is weak.

claims.text: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Astronauts from multiple space programs have confirmed the Great Wall is not visible from orbit without magnification. NASA astronauts specifically debunked this urban myth.

claims.text: Goldfish have a three-second memory
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Research shows goldfish can remember for months and can be trained to recognize shapes, colors, and sounds. Some studies suggest memory capabilities lasting up to 5 months.

claims.text: COVID-19 vaccines were developed using fetal tissue
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: While some vaccine development used fetal cell lines for research, the vaccines do not contain fetal cells. Fetal cell lines are widely used in medical research, including vaccines not politically sensitive.

claims.text: Antarctica is completely covered by ice
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Antarctica is covered by the Antarctic Ice Sheet, which covers approximately 98% of the continent. The remaining 2% consists of exposed rock outcrops, with some ice-free areas around the coast.

claims.text: The Titanic wreck lies at a depth of approximately 12,500 feet
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: The wreck is located at approximately 12,500 feet (3,800 meters) in the North Atlantic. This depth and location have been repeatedly verified through sonar mapping and submersible dives.

claims.text: Lightning never strikes the same place twice
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Lightning frequently strikes the same location multiple times. The Empire State Building is struck approximately 20-25 times per year. Tall structures and geographical features are repeat targets.

claims.text: We use only 10% of our brains
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Neuroscience confirms we use virtually all of our brain. Brain imaging shows all regions are active constantly, even during sleep. Damage to any region causes functional loss.

claims.text: The human body contains approximately 37 trillion cells
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: A widely cited 2013 study estimated the human body contains approximately 37.2 trillion cells. This figure has become the standard reference in medical and biological literature.

claims.text: The Great Wall of China is the only human-made structure visible from the Moon
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Multiple human-made structures are visible from the Moon if you know where to look, and the Great Wall is not one of them. Astronauts report the wall is difficult to distinguish even from orbit.

claims.text: Honey never spoils and can last indefinitely
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Honey's low moisture content and high acidity create an environment where bacteria cannot survive. Archaeologists have found 3,000-year-old honey that remains edible. Properly stored honey does not expire.

claims.text: All types of alcohol have the same number of calories per unit volume
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Pure ethanol contains approximately 7 calories per gram regardless of source. However, different alcoholic beverages vary in calorie content due to sugars, ingredients, and alcohol concentration.

claims.text: Sugar makes children hyperactive
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Multiple controlled studies found no direct link between sugar consumption and hyperactivity in children. The belief persists due to expectancy bias and context of sugar consumption at parties.

claims.text: The Dead Sea is the lowest point on Earth's surface
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: The Dead Sea surface is approximately 1,410 feet (430 meters) below sea level, making it the lowest point on Earth's land surface. The Mariana Trench is deeper but underwater.

claims.text: Glass is actually a very slow-flowing liquid
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Glass is an amorphous solid, not a liquid. The myth originated from misunderstanding old window glass thickness variations, which resulted from manufacturing processes, not flowing.

claims.text: Cracking knuckles causes arthritis
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: A longitudinal study following people who cracked their knuckles found no increased risk of arthritis. The popping sound comes from gas bubbles in synovial fluid, not joint damage.

claims.text: Reading in dim light damages your eyesight
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Ophthalmologists confirm that reading in dim light does not cause permanent damage. While it may cause temporary eye strain, the eyes are not permanently harmed.

claims.text: Shaving causes hair to grow back thicker
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Dermatologists explain that hair appears thicker when shaved because the blunt edge feels coarser. The growth rate and thickness are unaffected by shaving.

claims.text: Microwaves make food radioactive
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Microwaves use non-ionizing radiation. They heat food by exciting water molecules but do not produce radioactivity. The food remains non-radioactive after microwaving.

claims.text: Humans can see ultraviolet light
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Human eyes are sensitive to visible light wavelengths (380-700 nm). Ultraviolet light (10-380 nm) cannot be seen by humans. The human eye is designed to filter out UV radiation.

claims.text: The first transatlantic telegraph cable was successfully laid in 1858
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: The first successful transatlantic telegraph cable connected Ireland and Newfoundland in 1858. It revolutionized international communication and operated for about 18 months before failure.

claims.text: Alcohol kills brain cells
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Moderate alcohol consumption does not directly kill brain cells in healthy adults. However, excessive drinking and alcohol abuse can damage brain tissue and neurons through various mechanisms.

claims.text: The Bermuda Triangle has an unusually high number of disappearances
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Analysis of maritime and aviation data shows the Bermuda Triangle region has no more disappearances than any other ocean area of similar size. The myth was popularized by a sensationalized 1974 book.

claims.text: The earth is flat
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Overwhelming scientific evidence confirms Earth is an oblate spheroid. Satellite imagery, gravity measurements, circumnavigation, and basic physics all confirm Earth's spherical shape.

claims.text: Humans share 99% of their DNA with chimpanzees
claims.fact_checker_reasoning: Genetic studies show humans and chimpanzees share approximately 98-99% of their DNA sequences. The remaining 1-2% accounts for significant physiological and behavioral differences through evolutionary divergence.
